e4: As a board member, I believe ethical conduct and transparency are paramount. While changing to an unbiased reporting policy may cause short-term volatility, it ultimately builds trust with investors in the long run. Hiding the truth, even if accepted by the market, is ethically problematic and exposes the company to significant legal and reputational risks.
e5: An ethical reporting policy prioritizes transparency and accuracy, presenting a fair and unbiased view of a company's financial performance.  It must adhere to accounting standards, clearly disclose any material information, and avoid manipulating data to mislead investors.  While market perception is important, ethical considerations should always guide financial reporting practices.
e6: Yes. I'd ask about their plan to communicate the policy change to investors, focusing on clarity and transparency.  Additionally, what steps are being taken to ensure continued investor trust and address any potential concerns regarding past practices.
